meanings: classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角 , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分)
(negative prefix for verbs) have not; not
classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
(used in the same way as 把: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
(emphatic sentence-final particle, used instead of 啊 after a word ending in "n")
which? (interrogative, followed by classifier or numeral-classifier)
(used in rhetorical questions) how can ...?; how could ...?
(pronoun) that (referring to persons, things or situations)
Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 位
particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")
particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")
particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")
(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您)
you (Note: In Taiwan, 妳 is used to address females, but in mainland China, it is not commonly used. Instead, 你 is used to address both males and females.)
you (courteous, as opposed to informal 你)
(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate
classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to get (from a depot or counter)
starting from (a time, place, price etc)
classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance
(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state
indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站)
(after a perception verb, e.g. 看) expressing preliminary judgment
unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 两
